The Prisoner is one of Napa’s most popular wines. It also glamorizes something ugly

There is no winery in Napa Valley like the Prisoner Wine Co. The sleek building with dangling handcuff decor is a popular attraction. Its wine, the Prisoner red blend, is among the nation’s best-selling — a wine for the people, even at its high price point. But few have questioned a fundamental aspect of the brand: its use of imprisonment as a marketing aesthetic.

TikTok and billboards: Public schools pay up to boost image and bring in students

Bay Area public school officials, eyeing enrollment declines and teacher shortages, are hiring professional firms to boost their image so they can lure and keep families and qualified candidates. While schools aren’t soft drinks, education over the past couple of decades has become a competitive marketplace.
